item.title: Often Missing From The Current Health Care Debate: Women's Voices
item.description: August 16, 2017 - When leaders in Washington discuss the future of American health care, women are not always in the room. Here, eight women from around the country share their personal stories, fears and hopes.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 16, 2017 - When leaders in Washington discuss the future of American health care, women are not always in the room. Here, eight women from around the country share their personal stories, fears and hopes. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/08/16/543723927/often-missing-from-the-current-health-care-debate-womens-voices

item.title: After Charlottesville, A Doctor Reflects On Hateful Patients And His Own Biases
item.description: August 16, 2017 - Medical professionals take pride in their commitment to care for all patients. But that pride doesn't shield them from the difficult ones.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 16, 2017 - Medical professionals take pride in their commitment to care for all patients. But that pride doesn't shield them from the difficult ones. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/08/16/543883816/after-charlottesville-a-doctor-reflects-on-hateful-patients-and-his-own-biases

item.title: Hippos, Anthrax And Hunger Make A Deadly Mix
item.description: August 16, 2017 - In Zambia, some people were so hungry that they risked their health to eat hippo meat infected with anthrax. Researchers say it reveals how food insecurity can spread disease.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 16, 2017 - In Zambia, some people were so hungry that they risked their health to eat hippo meat infected with anthrax. Researchers say it reveals how food insecurity can spread disease. http://www.npr.org/2017/08/16/543900930/hippos-anthrax-and-hunger-make-a-deadly-mix

item.title: Shh! These Quiet Food Videos Will Get Your Senses Tingling
item.description: August 16, 2017 - A growing number of food videos aim to trigger ASMR — Autonomous Sensory Meridian Response, or pleasing sensations in the brains of some viewers — by focusing on sounds like chopping and stirring.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 16, 2017 - A growing number of food videos aim to trigger ASMR — Autonomous Sensory Meridian Response, or pleasing sensations in the brains of some viewers — by focusing on sounds like chopping and stirring. http://www.npr.org/2017/08/16/542903392/shh-these-quiet-food-videos-will-get-your-senses-tingling

item.title: 'Body Brokers' Get Kickbacks To Lure People With Addictions To Bad Rehab
item.description: August 15, 2017 - In South Florida, people with health insurance are the target of "body brokers" who can earn lucrative kickbacks — $500 per week — for referring vulnerable patients to centers that bilk insurers.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 15, 2017 - In South Florida, people with health insurance are the target of "body brokers" who can earn lucrative kickbacks — $500 per week — for referring vulnerable patients to centers that bilk insurers. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/08/15/542630442/body-brokers-get-kickbacks-to-lure-people-with-addictions-to-bad-rehab

item.title: CBO Predicts Rise In Deficit If Trump Cuts Payments To Insurance Companies
item.description: August 15, 2017 - The Congressional Budget Office estimates that ending what's known as cost-sharing reduction payments to insurers will raise the deficit $194 billion over 10 years.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 15, 2017 - The Congressional Budget Office estimates that ending what's known as cost-sharing reduction payments to insurers will raise the deficit $194 billion over 10 years. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/08/15/543714171/cbo-predicts-rise-in-deficit-if-trump-cuts-payments-to-insurance-companies

item.title: Can My Boss Make Me Pay The Tax On My Great Health Plan? Maybe Yes
item.description: August 15, 2017 - Since Congress hasn't passed a fix, employers who offer generous health care plans may look to shift the tax burden to employees if the so-called "Cadillac tax" kicks in.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 15, 2017 - Since Congress hasn't passed a fix, employers who offer generous health care plans may look to shift the tax burden to employees if the so-called "Cadillac tax" kicks in. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/08/14/543518973/can-my-boss-make-me-pay-the-tax-on-my-great-health-plan-maybe-yes

item.title: In The Event Of A Nuclear Blast, Don't Condition Your Hair
item.description: August 15, 2017 - That advice came in guidelines issued to residents of Guam on how to prepare for a missile threat on the island. The reason is conditioner can trap radioactive particles in strands of hair.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 15, 2017 - That advice came in guidelines issued to residents of Guam on how to prepare for a missile threat on the island. The reason is conditioner can trap radioactive particles in strands of hair. http://www.npr.org/2017/08/15/543647878/in-the-event-of-a-nuclear-blast-don-t-condition-your-hair

item.title: Why U.S.-Trained Surgeons Often Aren't Ready For Humanitarian Work Abroad
item.description: August 15, 2017 - A study compares surgeries performed by Doctors Without Borders volunteers in the developing world with those taught to U.S. surgical residents — and finds "a dramatic mismatch."
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 15, 2017 - A study compares surgeries performed by Doctors Without Borders volunteers in the developing world with those taught to U.S. surgical residents — and finds "a dramatic mismatch." http://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2017/08/15/542797397/why-u-s-trained-surgeons-arent-ready-for-humanitarian-work-abroad

item.title: 6,000-Year-Old Knee Joints Suggest Osteoarthritis Isn't Just Wear And Tear
item.description: August 15, 2017 - Even after a Harvard team took into account differences in age and weight among ancient specimens and knees today, they found that modern humans tend to have more osteoarthritis.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 15, 2017 - Even after a Harvard team took into account differences in age and weight among ancient specimens and knees today, they found that modern humans tend to have more osteoarthritis. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/08/15/543402095/creaky-knees

item.title: After Mastectomy, Young Woman's Tattoo Helps Her Feel Whole Again
item.description: August 14, 2017 - Nicole was only 23 when she had a double mastectomy following a breast cancer diagnosis. After she recovered, Nicole got a chest tattoo that symbolized how she wants to live life after cancer.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 14, 2017 - Nicole was only 23 when she had a double mastectomy following a breast cancer diagnosis. After she recovered, Nicole got a chest tattoo that symbolized how she wants to live life after cancer. http://www.npr.org/2017/08/14/543477483/after-mastectomy-young-womans-tattoo-helps-her-feel-whole-again

item.title: Poet Imagines Life Inside A 1910 Institution That Eugenics Built
item.description: August 14, 2017 - Molly McCully Brown, who has cerebral palsy, says that if she'd been born in a different era, she might have been sent to the "Virginia State Colony," an early landmark of the U.S. eugenics movement.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 14, 2017 - Molly McCully Brown, who has cerebral palsy, says that if she'd been born in a different era, she might have been sent to the "Virginia State Colony," an early landmark of the U.S. eugenics movement. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/08/14/543362834/poet-imagines-life-inside-a-1910-institution-that-eugenics-built

item.title: Trump Administration Extends Deadline For Insurers To Decide On Obamacare Markets
item.description: August 14, 2017 - The extension leaves time for President Trump to decide whether to continue crucial payments to insurers and for insurers to figure out how they would operate without them if they were to disappear.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 14, 2017 - The extension leaves time for President Trump to decide whether to continue crucial payments to insurers and for insurers to figure out how they would operate without them if they were to disappear. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/08/14/543414938/trump-administration-extends-deadline-for-insurers-to-decide-on-obamacare-market

item.title: Nurse Wins Prize For Research On Benefits Of Faster Tuberculosis Testing
item.description: August 14, 2017 - Chenai Mathabire dreamed of being a model, but life had different plans. She recently won an award for proving that a rapid TB test could be used successfully in clinics across southeastern Africa.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 14, 2017 - Chenai Mathabire dreamed of being a model, but life had different plans. She recently won an award for proving that a rapid TB test could be used successfully in clinics across southeastern Africa. http://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2017/08/14/541603601/nurse-wins-prize-for-research-on-benefits-of-faster-tuberculosis-testing

item.title: Work Can Be Stressful, Dangerous And Sometimes Great
item.description: August 14, 2017 - America's workers are subject to more physical harm and emotional stress than you might think, but many of these challenges can be mitigated by a good boss and good friends.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 14, 2017 - America's workers are subject to more physical harm and emotional stress than you might think, but many of these challenges can be mitigated by a good boss and good friends. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/08/14/542907572/work-can-be-stressful-dangerous-and-sometimes-great
